26#include <sys/cdefs.h>
27__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: nouveau_nvkm_subdev_timer_base.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:35 riastradh Exp $");
28
29#include "priv.h"
30
31u64
32nvkm_timer_read(struct nvkm_timer *tmr)
33{
34 return tmr->func->read(tmr);
35}
36
37void
38nvkm_timer_alarm_trigger(struct nvkm_timer *tmr)
39{
40 struct nvkm_alarm *alarm, *atemp;
41 unsigned long flags;
42 struct list_head exec = LIST_HEAD_INIT(exec);
43
44 /* Process pending alarms. */
45 spin_lock_irqsave(&tmr->lock, flags);
46 list_for_each_entry_safe(alarm, atemp, &tmr->alarms, head) {
47 /* Have we hit the earliest alarm that hasn't gone off? */
48 if (alarm->timestamp > nvkm_timer_read(tmr)) {
49 /* Schedule it. If we didn't race, we're done. */
50 tmr->func->alarm_init(tmr, alarm->timestamp);
51 if (alarm->timestamp > nvkm_timer_read(tmr))
52 break;
53 }
54
55 /* Move to completed list. We'll drop the lock before
56 * executing the callback so it can reschedule itself.
57 */
58 list_del_init(&alarm->head);
59 list_add(&alarm->exec, &exec);
60 }
61
62 /* Shut down interrupt if no more pending alarms. */
63 if (list_empty(&tmr->alarms))
64 tmr->func->alarm_fini(tmr);
65 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tmr->lock, flags);
66
67 /* Execute completed callbacks. */
68 list_for_each_entry_safe(alarm, atemp, &exec, exec) {
69 list_del(&alarm->exec);
70 alarm->func(alarm);
71 }
72}
73
74void
75nvkm_timer_alarm(struct nvkm_timer *tmr, u32 nsec, struct nvkm_alarm *alarm)
76{
77 struct nvkm_alarm *list;
78 unsigned long flags;
79
80 /* Remove alarm from pending list.
81 *
82 * This both protects against the corruption of the list,
83 * and implements alarm rescheduling/cancellation.
84 */
85 spin_lock_irqsave(&tmr->lock, flags);
86 list_del_init(&alarm->head);
87
88 if (nsec) {
89 /* Insert into pending list, ordered earliest to latest. */
90 alarm->timestamp = nvkm_timer_read(tmr) + nsec;
91 list_for_each_entry(list, &tmr->alarms, head) {
92 if (list->timestamp > alarm->timestamp)
93 break;
94 }
95
96 list_add_tail(&alarm->head, &list->head);
97
98 /* Update HW if this is now the earliest alarm. */
99 list = list_first_entry(&tmr->alarms, typeof(*list), head);
100 if (list == alarm) {
101 tmr->func->alarm_init(tmr, alarm->timestamp);
102 /* This shouldn't happen if callers aren't stupid.
103 *
104 * Worst case scenario is that it'll take roughly
105 * 4 seconds for the next alarm to trigger.
106 */
107 WARN_ON(alarm->timestamp <= nvkm_timer_read(tmr));
108 }
109 }
110 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tmr->lock, flags);
111}
112
113void
114nvkm_timer_alarm_cancel(struct nvkm_timer *tmr, struct nvkm_alarm *alarm)
115{
116 unsigned long flags;
117 spin_lock_irqsave(&tmr->lock, flags);
118 list_del_init(&alarm->head);
119 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&tmr->lock, flags);
120}
121
122static void
123nvkm_timer_intr(struct nvkm_subdev *subdev)
124{
125 struct nvkm_timer *tmr = nvkm_timer(subdev);
126 tmr->func->intr(tmr);
127}
128
129static int
130nvkm_timer_fini(struct nvkm_subdev *subdev, bool suspend)
131{
132 struct nvkm_timer *tmr = nvkm_timer(subdev);
133 tmr->func->alarm_fini(tmr);
134 return 0;
135}
136
137static int
138nvkm_timer_init(struct nvkm_subdev *subdev)
139{
140 struct nvkm_timer *tmr = nvkm_timer(subdev);
141 if (tmr->func->init)
142 tmr->func->init(tmr);
143 tmr->func->time(tmr, ktime_to_ns(ktime_get()));
144 nvkm_timer_alarm_trigger(tmr);
145 return 0;
146}
147
148static void *
149nvkm_timer_dtor(struct nvkm_subdev *subdev)
150{
151 return nvkm_timer(subdev);
152}
153
154static const struct nvkm_subdev_func
155nvkm_timer = {
156 .dtor = nvkm_timer_dtor,
157 .init = nvkm_timer_init,
158 .fini = nvkm_timer_fini,
159 .intr = nvkm_timer_intr,
160};
161
162int
163nvkm_timer_new_(const struct nvkm_timer_func *func, struct nvkm_device *device,
164 int index, struct nvkm_timer **ptmr)
165{
166 struct nvkm_timer *tmr;
167
168 if (!(tmr = *ptmr = kzalloc(sizeof(*tmr), GFP_KERNEL)))
169 return -ENOMEM;
170
171 nvkm_subdev_ctor(&nvkm_timer, device, index, 0, &tmr->subdev);
172 tmr->func = func;
173 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&tmr->alarms);
174 spin_lock_init(&tmr->lock);
175 return 0;
176}
